hanzi-su-wiki:
縫

Значения

Шить, зашивать

Мнемоника

При шитье нитки 糸 периодически встречаются 逢 друг с другом.

Варианты

缝

rtega_mnemonic:
縫縫RS
缝缝		sew, mend, suture, crack, fissure

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 缝)
Pictophonetic: 逢 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
縫隙 [ fèng xì ]: small crack; chink
縫紉機 [ féng rèn jī ]: sewing machine; Classifiers: 架
縫合 [ féng hé ]: to sew together; suture (in surgery); to sew up (a wound)
縫紉 [ féng rèn ]: to sew; tailoring
縫補 [ féng bǔ ]: to darn (clothing); to sew and mend
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 逢 [ féng ] to happen to meet; chance meeting, coincidence
heisig_chinese_memo: If Spidey can chance upon some thread and extra time he'll sew up tears in his suit nicely, otherwise he'll just spray some web over it.
heisig_constituent: sew, thread, spiderman, tryst, Segway, Macbeth, walking legs, bushes, road
koohiiStory1: Pointy primitive; with a pointy needle you sew a road (-------) of threads.
koohiiStory2: Good thing I brought some thread, cause I need to sew my pants that I tore up walking through the bushes (see summit (#1562)) before we hit the road to go back down the mountain.
jp_example_words:
裁縫(さいほう): sewing
縫う(ぬう): sew
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You take some thread, put your scooter up to a signpost, and sew them together. You don't have a lock, so sewing your scooter up to the signpost to keep it safe is all you can think of.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine slowly sewing your scooter to the signpost, passing the thread back and forth through the signpost's metal holes and your scooter's handles.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You usually only sew at home (ほう), so this is a big exception for you. You're usually worried that if you sew in public people will judge your stitches, so this is a big step for you!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hopefully, if your scooter is still here later you'll be able to start sewing outside of your home more often from now on!
Ru_Notes: Фонетик и не путать: 逢 (あう、ホウ свидание), фонетик: 夆 (するどい、ホウ острие, точка схождения).
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 込 (внутрь), 夂 (зима), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese:
féng: (глаг) шить, штопать
fèng: (сущ) шов; трещина, щель
Kanshudo_mnemonic: meeting (逢) of threads (糸) = sewing
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spidey chanced upon some new advanced sewing machine where you don't have to do any work. With all the rips in his suits he of course bought it immediately.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "糸", " Feng " sound. Warring States text " seam " from there " Shito ", " butt " and the sound from " Shito ", " Feng -shaped" sound. The original meaning is to connect with stitches. "Said Wen": "Sew, use needles to make clothes. From Shitou, every sound." Such as "Poetry. Guofeng. Ge Qi: "If you mix with female hands, you can sew clothes." "Historical Records. Biography of Hengshan Mountain in Huainan: "One foot of cloth can still be sewn; a bucket of millet can still be pounded. Two brothers are incompatible."

The extension of " seam " means bridging and complementing. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-sixth Year of Xie Gong": "Huan Gong is to entangle the princes, and seek their disagreement, to close their gaps, and to rescue their disasters, to show their old duties." Chen Kongzhang "For Yuan Shao's Yuzhou": "The shogunate's gangster, before the training, add the Xuxuan content, Ji Ke Mi sew." "Southern Qi Shu. "The Biographies of Kong Zhigui": "Five rituals are split and re-sewn, six music is decadent and 爰qi."

" Seam " also refers to the seam. "Guang Yun. Rhyme: "Sewing, sewing." Such as "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Shang": "The ancients, the crown shrinks and the seams are now evenly seamed." Wei Ruan Ji of the Three Kingdoms "Mr. Adult Biography": "You can't see the lice in the middle, escape the deep seams, hide the bad flocs, think yourself Yoshizhai."

" Seam " also means voids and cracks. For example, Yuan Zhen's "Spider" in the Tang Dynasty: "The gaps are long and the void is weaving horizontally." Zheng Chao of the Tang Dynasty "Title Cui Xingxian Stone House Villa": "Guiyin grows wild fungus, and the stone joints are cold." "Journey to the West" No. 21 Reply: "The walker will go in through the cracks of the door. It turned out to be a big empty garden. Tang Sengli was tied with a rope on the fixed wind pile."
humanum_short_description_en: From " Shito " to " Feng " sound. The original meaning is to connect with stitches.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「逢」聲。戰國文字的「縫」有從「糸」，「夆」聲和從「糸」，「奉」聲的字形。本義是用針綫連接起來。《說文》：「縫，以鍼紩衣也。从糸，逢聲。」如《詩．國風．葛屨》：「摻摻女手，可以縫裳。」《史記．淮南衡山列傳》：「一尺布，尚可縫；一斗粟，尚可舂。兄弟二人不能相容。」

　　「縫」引申表示彌合、補合。如《左傳．僖公二十六年》：「桓公是以糾合諸侯，而謀其不協，彌縫其闕，而匡救其災，昭舊職也。」《文選．陳孔璋〈為袁紹檄豫州〉》：「幕府方詰外姦，未及整訓，加緒含容，冀可彌縫。」《南齊書．孔稚珪列傳》：「五禮裂而復縫，六樂頹而爰緝。」

　　「縫」又指縫合處。《廣韻．用韻》：「縫，衣縫。」如《禮記．檀弓上》：「古者，冠縮縫，今也衡縫。」三國魏阮籍《大人先生傳》：「獨不見乎虱之處於㡓中，逃乎深縫，匿乎壞絮，自以為吉宅。」

　　「縫」亦表示空隙、裂縫。如唐代元稹〈蜘蛛〉：「縫隙容長踦，虛空織橫羅。」唐代鄭巢〈題崔行先石室別墅〉：「桂陰生野菌，石縫結寒澌。」《西遊記》第21回：「行者漫門縫兒鑽將進去，原來是個大空園子，那壁廂定風樁上繩纏索綁著唐僧哩。」
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「逢」聲。本義是用針綫連接起來。

裁縫(さいほう): sewing
縫う(ぬう): sew

從「 糸 」，「 逢 」聲。戰國文字的「 縫 」有從「 糸 」，「 夆 」聲和從「 糸 」，「 奉 」聲的字形。本義是用針綫連接起來。《說文》：「縫，以鍼紩衣也。从糸，逢聲。」如《詩．國風．葛屨》：「摻摻女手，可以縫裳。」《史記．淮南衡山列傳》：「一尺布，尚可縫；一斗粟，尚可舂。兄弟二人不能相容。」 「 縫 」引申表示彌合、補合。如《左傳．僖公二十六年》：「桓公是以糾合諸侯，而謀其不協，彌縫其闕，而匡救其災，昭舊職也。」《文選．陳孔璋〈為袁紹檄豫州〉》：「幕府方詰外姦，未及整訓，加緒含容，冀可彌縫。」《南齊書．孔稚珪列傳》：「五禮裂而復縫，六樂頹而爰緝。」 「 縫 」又指縫合處。《廣韻．用韻》：「縫，衣縫。」如《禮記．檀弓上》：「古者，冠縮縫，今也衡縫。」三國魏阮籍《大人先生傳》：「獨不見乎虱之處於㡓中，逃乎深縫，匿乎壞絮，自以為吉宅。」 「 縫 」亦表示空隙、裂縫。如唐代元稹〈蜘蛛〉：「縫隙容長踦，虛空織橫羅。」唐代鄭巢〈題崔行先石室別墅〉：「桂陰生野菌，石縫結寒澌。」《西遊記》第21回：「行者漫門縫兒鑽將進去，原來是個大空園子，那壁廂定風樁上繩纏索綁著唐僧哩。」
From " 糸", " Feng" sound. Warring States text " seam" from there " Shito", " butt" and the sound from " Shito", " Feng -shaped" sound. The original meaning is to connect with stitches. "Said Wen": "Sew, use needles to make clothes. From Shitou, every sound." Such as "Poetry. Guofeng. Ge Qi: "If you mix with female hands, you can sew clothes." "Historical Records. Biography of Hengshan Mountain in Huainan: "One foot of cloth can still be sewn; a bucket of millet can still be pounded. Two brothers are incompatible." The extension of " seam" means bridging and complementing. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-sixth Year of Xie Gong": "Huan Gong is to entangle the princes, and seek their disagreement, to close their gaps, and to rescue their disasters, to show their old duties." Chen Kongzhang "For Yuan Shao's Yuzhou": "The shogunate's gangster, before the training, add the Xuxuan content, Ji Ke Mi sew." "Southern Qi Shu. "The Biographies of Kong Zhigui": "Five rituals are split and re-sewn, six music is decadent and 爰qi." " Seam" also refers to the seam. "Guang Yun. Rhyme: "Sewing, sewing." Such as "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Shang": "The ancients, the crown shrinks and the seams are now evenly seamed." Wei Ruan Ji of the Three Kingdoms "Mr. Adult Biography": "You can't see the lice in the middle, escape the deep seams, hide the bad flocs, think yourself Yoshizhai." " Seam" also means voids and cracks. For example, Yuan Zhen's "Spider" in the Tang Dynasty: "The gaps are long and the void is weaving horizontally." Zheng Chao of the Tang Dynasty "Title Cui Xingxian Stone House Villa": "Guiyin grows wild fungus, and the stone joints are cold." "Journey to the West" No. 21 Reply: "The walker will go in through the cracks of the door. It turned out to be a big empty garden. Tang Sengli was tied with a rope on the fixed wind pile."

縫字的基本解释

縫
féng

縫
fèng
均见“缝”。

縫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［féng］
［《廣韻》符容切，平鍾，奉。］
“缝1”的繁体字。亦作“綘1”。
(1)用针线连缀。
(2)补合。
[②]［fèng］
［《廣韻》扶用切，去用，奉。］
“缝2”的繁体字。
(1)缝合的地方。
(2)空隙；裂缝。

縫字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　縫； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页935第21
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?符容切，音逢。【說文】以鍼紩衣也。【詩·召南】羔羊之縫。【傳】縫言縫殺之，大小得其制。又【魏風】可以縫裳。【左傳·昭二年】敢拜子之彌縫敞邑。【註】猶補合也。　又【集韻】符風切【正韻】符中切，?音馮。義同。　又【廣韻】扶用切【集韻】房用切，?音俸。衣縫也。【周禮·天官】縫人掌王宮之縫線之事。【禮·檀弓】古者冠縮縫，今也衡縫。

考證：〔【左傳·昭二年】敢拜子之彌縫。〕　謹照原文彌縫下增敞邑二字。
縫字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

暂无。

féng, fèng
вм. 缝
Radicals: 糸, 夆  (thread, signpost, scooter)
Meaning Mnemonic
You take some thread, put your scooter up to a signpost, and sew them together. You don't have a lock, so sewing your scooter up to the signpost to keep it safe is all you can think of.
Imagine slowly sewing your scooter to the signpost, passing the thread back and forth through the signpost's metal holes and your scooter's handles.
Reading Mnemonic
You usually only sew at home (ほう), so this is a big exception for you. You're usually worried that if you sew in public people will judge your stitches, so this is a big step for you!
Hopefully, if your scooter is still here later you'll be able to start sewing outside of your home more often from now on!
